section.title: Upgrading &name-web; and &name-web; Database
section.para: If there's a new &name-web; version available on &url-icinga; you should consider updating. Newer versions contain bugfixes, minor or major, which makes it even more important to get the latest and the greatest. If you already installed &name-web;; using the installing guide it's rather easy to install newer version.

Make sure you'll have a safe backup of your &name-web; installation and your configs (if you stored your customised configuration in *.site.xml- Files, they won't be overwritten during the upgrade process!). If anything goes wrong you can restore your old setup rather easy.

Regular updates of &name-web; are possible by just by re-installing &name-web;. Please keep in mind that configure requires the same parameters as before - look it up in config.log and save that in a safe location.
Please make sure, that you have already installed the appropriate &name-api; version. Installing the &name-api; is described in the Icinga-API section.
Please download the archive from http://sourceforge.net/projects/icinga/files/ or take your clone from the icinga-web.git to get the freshest branch:
section.programlisting: #> ./configure --prefix=/usr/local/icinga-web --with-web-user=www-data --with-web-group=www-data --with-web-path=/icinga-web --with-web-apache-path=/etc/apache2/conf.d --with-db-type=mysql --with-db-host=localhost --with-db-port=3306 --with-db-name=icinga_web --with-db-user=icinga_web --with-db-pass=icinga_web --with-icinga-api=/usr/local/icinga/share/icinga-api --with-api-type=APICON API type (default CONNECTION_IDO) --with-api-subtype=TYPE DB driver or network connection --with-api-host=HOST Host to connect (DB or other) (default localhost) --with-api-port=PORT Port for connection (default 3306) --with-api-socket=PATH Path to socket (default none)

note.para: Keep in mind that you configure the Icinga Web database not the Icinga IDOUtils database! User and group name of the web process depend on the distribution used.
Using no options the installer expects the &name-api; to be found at /usr/local/icinga/share/icinga-api.

listitem.para: Backup your current database before upgrading!

Apply the upgrade(s) using a rdbm user with appropriate rights.
